meanings.sent1: She is preannouncing her birthday party to make sure everyone can attend.
meanings.sent2: The company is preannouncing their new product launch to build excitement.
meanings.sent3: The cat is preannouncing its presence by meowing loudly at the door.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds preannounce the incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher preannounced the surprise quiz to give the students time to prepare.

meanings.definition: The act of announcing something before it happens.
meanings.sent1: The preannouncing of the winner's name created anticipation among the audience.
meanings.sent2: Preannouncing can sometimes spoil the surprise element of an event.
meanings.sent3: The preannouncing of the test results made the students nervous.
meanings.sent4: The preannouncing of the sale attracted many customers to the store.
meanings.sent5: The preannouncing of the movie release date built up excitement among fans.
